column1: Minusinsk (Russian: Минуси́нск) is a historical town in Krasnoyarsk Krai
== Geography ==
Minusinsk marks the center of the Minusinsk Hollow
column2: one of the most important archaeological areas north of Pazyryk. It is associated with the Afanasevo
column4: and Tagar cultures—all of them named after settlements in the vicinity of Minusinsk.

column1: == History ==
About 330-200 B.C. the iron age triumphed at Minusinsk, producing spiked axes, partly bronze and partly iron, and a group of large collective burial places.  Greco-Roman funerary masks
column3: make up the "Minusinsk group: at Trifonova
column8: etc."  "The Indo-European aristocracy with its Sarmatian connections was succeeded at Minusinsk by the Kirghiz after the third century A.D."The Russian settlement of Minyusinskoye (Минюсинское) was founded in 1739-1740 at the confluence of the Minusa River with the Yenisei. The Turkic Min Usa means "my brook"
column9: or "thousand rivers". The name transformed to Minusinskoye (Минусинское) in 1810.

column2: Minusinsk had emerged as a regional center of farming and transit trade and was granted town status. During the 19th century
column3: it was a node of cultural activities for a very large area. The Martyanov Natural History Museum was opened there in 1877. It is still very active and publishes a quite useful annual report of its scientific findings

column1: The town was also a place of political exile. George Kennan wrote in his very influential book Siberia and the Exile System (NY 1891) of the town and the museum being an intellectual haven for those tsarist political activists and revolutionaries who had been exiled from European Russia in the 1880s. Vladimir Lenin used to visit Minusinsk on numerous occasions when he was in exile in the nearby village of Shushenskoye between 1897 and 1900. In November 1918
column3: Minusinsk peasants started a short-lived rebellion against the White Army because of extortion and high taxes. However
column4: poor equipment and supplies led to eventual defeat in the December
column5: and the rebels were subjected to execution

column1: == Administrative and municipal status ==
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Minusinsk serves as the administrative center of Minusinsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column5: together with the urban-type settlement of Zelyony Bor
column6: incorporated separately as the krai town of Minusinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: the krai town of Minusinsk is incorporated as Minusinsk Urban Okrug.

column1: == Climate ==
Minusinsk has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb/Dwb)
column2: with very cold winters and warm summers. Precipitation is quite low
column3: but is much higher from June to September than at other times of the year.
